section.title: Requirements
section.p: The Eclim plugins for vim require vim 7. At the time of this writing, vim 7 is still alpha, but I have yet to encounter any major issues with it. For information on obtaining and installing vim 7 please see the installation docs.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: Currently there are only a couple of global configuration settings available.

ul.li: g:EclimDebug (Default: 0) - Setting this variable to 1 will turn on some simple debugging.

g:EclimCommand (Default: "eclim") - This variable is used to configure the command used for the eclim client. Currently the only other alternative is "eclim-lite" which uses nailgun to improve performance.

section.title: Global shared functions
section.p: The following set of functions are available to any plug-in that wishes to enhance the vim integration with eclim and Eclipse. If you don't plan on adding any new functionality, then you can safely skip this section.

ul.li:
GetCurrentElementPosition()
Gets the current position of the element under the cursor for use with eclim. The result is in the form "offset;length" where the offset is the number of characters from the start of the file and the length is the length of the element.

ExecuteEclim(args)
Executes the eclim client and returns the results. The parameter "args" is expected to be a string with all the command line arguments to be passed to eclim.

PopulateQuickfix(resultsFile)
Populates the quickfix window with the results in the file name supplied. The results in the file are excepted to be in the form of "%f|%l col %c|%m".
%f: the filename
%l: the line number
%c: the column number
%m: the message

PromptList(prompt, list, highlight)
Prompts the user to choose from the supplied list. "prompt" is the text used to explain to the user what they are choosing from. "list" is the list of elements to choose from. "highlight" is the highlight group to use for the prompt. The result returned is the index in the list that the user chose.
